|publisher=Sify |date=31 October 2012 |accessdate=31 October 2012}} ===Filming=== [[Principal photography]] of the film was to begin on Chennai on 31 May 2012, but started with a slight delay on 2 June 2012 with portions involving [[Nayantara]] and [[Arya (actor)|Arya]],{{cite web|author=V Lakshmi |url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/regional/tamil/news-interviews/Monsoon-break-for-Ajith-Vishnu/articleshow_b2/13669471.cms |title=Monsoon break for Ajith, Vishnu|work=The Times of India|accessdate=31 October 2013}} while Ajith Kumar joined them a day later.{{cite web|author=5 June 2012 By Anupama Subramanian DC chennai |url=http://www.deccanchronicle.com/channels/showbiz/kollywood/ajith-joins-vishnu%E2%80%99s-shoot-927 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120607234919/http://www.deccanchronicle.com/channels/showbiz/kollywood/ajith-joins-vishnu%E2%80%99s-shoot-927 |archivedate=7 June 2012 |title=Ajith joins Vishnu’s shoot | Deccan Chronicle |publisher=Web.archive.org |date=8 June 2012 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} The filming was expected to proceed until the end of the month in [[Mumbai]],{{cite web|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/shoot-commences-for-tamil-star-ajiths-next/263325-71-180.html |title=Shoot commences for Tamil star Ajith's next |publisher=CNN-IBN |date=31 May 2012 |accessdate=31 May 2012 }}{{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} but was later cancelled due to monsoon and the location was shifted to [[Bangalore]].{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/ajith-vishnu-shifts-from-mumbai-to-bengaluru-news-tamil-mgtjecafabj.html?scategory=tamill |title=Ajith &Vishnu shifts from Mumbai to Bengaluru! |publisher=Sify |date=19 June 2012 |accessdate=31 October 2013}}{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/jun-12-03/ajith-vishnuvardhan-19-06-12.html |title=Ajith-Vishnuvardhan's Mumbai schedule stalled |publisher=Behindwoods |date=19 June 2012 |accessdate=26 June 2012}} and later in [[Hyderabad, India|Hyderabad]].{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/jun-12-04/ajith-vishnuvardhan-26-06-12.html |title=Ajith's shoot location shifted for fear of fans ambush |publisher=Behindwoods |date=26 June 2012 |accessdate=26 June 2012}} On 7 September, during the second schedule, [[Taapsee Pannu]] joined the crew and began shooting her portions.{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/taapasee-s-big-day-with-thala-co-news-tamil-mjhlHVcdehi.html |title=Taapasee`s big day with Thala & co |publisher=Sify |date=7 September 2012 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} For a fight scene, which was shot between 8 pm and 8 am the next day, Ajith spent several hours hanging upside down.{{cite news|agency=TNN |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-10-13/news-interviews/34430864_1_arya-and-taapsee-thala-ajith-action-time |title=Action time for Ajith|work=The Times of India|date=13 October 2012 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} During the next schedule that started on 2 November 2012, filming was held in [[Mumbai]] and its suburban locations.{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/ajith-to-shoot-in-mumbai-with-arya-news-tamil-mk5iQXagbch.html |title=Ajith to shoot in Mumbai with Arya! |publisher=Sify |date=31 October 2012 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} While shooting an action sequence, Ajith Kumar injured his leg while jumping from one car to another,{{cite news|agency=TNN |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-11-06/news-interviews/34947488_1_thala-ajith-vishnuvardhan-film-taapsee-pannu |title=Ajith injured in dare-devil stunt scene|work=The Times of India|date=6 November 2012 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} suffering an [[Anterior cruciate ligament injury|ligament tear]].{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/ajith-brushes-aside-injury-and-shoots-news-tamil-mlhjy2gghij.html |title=Ajith brushes aside injury and shoots |publisher=Sify |date=7 November 2012 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} Despite his injuries, Ajith Kumar continued shooting. Vishnuvardhan later revealed that it was Arya who drove the car when Ajith hurted his legs during the stunt scene.{{cite news|agency=TNN |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-08-15/news-interviews/41412736_1_siruthai-siva-ajith-arrambam |title=Arya behind the wheels of Ajith's accident|work=The Times of India|date=15 August 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} In late December a short shooting schedule was held in Chennai,{{cite news|agency=TNN |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-12-18/news-interviews/35890231_1_ajith-siruthai-fame-vishnuvardhan |title=Ajith back in action in Chennai|work=The Times of India|date=18 December 2012 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} during which a fight sequence featuring Ajith and Arya was shot.{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/89628.html |title=Fight between Ajith, Arya|publisher=IndiaGlitz |date=31 December 2012 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} The team returned to Mumbai a third time for a 15-day schedule on 1 January 2013, with scenes involving Arya, Nayantara and Taapsee being filmed in the [[Bandra]] area of Mumbai in the first week and Ajith Kumar's part in the latter part of the schedule.{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/thala-film-starts-rolling-again-in-mumbai-news-tamil-nbclBLjeibe.html |title='Thala' film starts rolling again in Mumbai! |publisher=Sify |date=2 January 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} The crew left for [[Dubai]] on 11 February 2013,{{cite news|agency=TNN |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-02-05/news-interviews/36764197_1_director-vishnuvardhan-ajith-vishnuvardhan-film-thala |title=Ajith-Vishnuvardhan film shoot in Dubai!|work=The Times of India|date=5 February 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}}{{cite web|url=http://behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-news-10/loads-of-work-ahead-for-ajith-and-co--ajith-vishnuvardhan-untitled-film-arya-11-02-13.html |title=Loads of work ahead for Ajith and co., Ajith Vishnuvardhan untitled film, Arya |publisher=Behindwoods |date=11 February 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} where Ajith filmed a boat sequence for the film, which was choreographed by Hollywood stuntman Lee Whittaker. After finishing the boat scene, he tweeted, "Finished amazing boat sequence here in Dubai! Ajith was absolutely amazing! Couldn't have done it without his skills!"{{cite web|author=Ramchander |url=http://entertainment.oneindia.in/tamil/news/2013/ajith-kumar-ducati-boat-103813.html |title=Ajith on a boat after Ducati|publisher=Oneindia Entertainment |date=21 February 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} Stills of Ajith Kumar riding a [[Ducati Diavel]] in Dubai also circulated in the Internet.{{cite news|agency=TNN |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-02-17/news-interviews/37144044_1_ajith-fans-thala-ajith-nayanthara-and-taapsee |title=Ajith enjoys Ducati ride|work=The Times of India|date=17 February 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} In March 2013, Ajith, Arya and Nayantara shot a [[holi]] song featuring both Tamil and [[Hindi]] lyrics at a studio in Mumbai,{{cite web|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-03-19/news-interviews/37842877_1_nayan-and-arya-holi-nayanthara |title=Ajith, Nayan and Arya celebrate Holi|work=The Times of India|date=19 March 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} which was choreographed by [[Dinesh Kumar (choreographer)|Dinesh]].{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/valai-team-celebrates-holi-in-mumbai-news-tamil-ndtpsNiehaj.html |title=Valai team celebrates Holi in Mumbai |publisher=Sify |date=19 March 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} The crew will be shooting the last schedule in [[Jaisalmer]] in [[Rajasthan]] from 1 May onwards,{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/ajith-to-celebrate-his-birthday-in-jaisalmer-news-tamil-neylM5fjcac.html |title=Ajith to celebrate his birthday in Jaisalmer! |publisher=Sify |date=24 April 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} after which the unit was reported to be moving to [[Orissa, India|Orissa]], where a song and a few scenes were to be shot.{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/regional/tamil/news-interviews/Ajith-to-have-a-working-birthday/articleshow/19720996.cms |title=Ajith to have a working birthday|work=The Times of India|date=25 April 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} It was followed by filming in [[Madhya Pradesh]],{{cite web|url=http://behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-news-10/ajith-and-vishnuvardhan-are-going-places-literally-ajith-53-ajith-vishnuvardhan-untitled-film-06-05-13.html |title=Ajith and Vishnuvardhan are going places, literally, Ajith 53, Ajith Vishnuvardhan untitled film |publisher=Behindwoods |date=6 May 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} [[Mahabaleshwar]], [[Maharashtra]].{{cite web|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-05-06/news-interviews/39063541_1_ajith-thala-director-vishnuvardhan |title=Ajith shoots in Mahabaleshwar|work=The Times of India|date=6 May 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} The climax scenes were filmed by mid-May in [[Kullu]] [[Manali, Himachal Pradesh|Manali]] in [[Himachal Pradesh]].{{cite web|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-05-13/news-interviews/39227585_1_ajith-work-siruthai-siva-ajith-vishnuvardhan-film |title=Ajith's final shoot in Kulu Manalai |work=The Times of India|date=13 May 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} The schedules were finished in July 2013,{{cite news|agency=TNN |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-07-01/news-interviews/40306722_1_am-rathnam-ajith-film-title |title=Ajith-Vishnu flick shoot wrapped |work=The Times of India|date=1 July 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} following which patch work remained. On 20 August 2013, another schedule was started in Chennai.{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/arrambam-shoot-starts-again-in-chennai-news-tamil-niul6Ogeahj.html |title='Arrambam' shoot starts again in Chennai |publisher=Sify |date=20 August 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} The entire filming was completed in early October 2013 with the last day shoot held in a Mumbai mall featuring Ajith and Arya.{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/ajiths-arrambam-shoot-complete-news-tamil-nkcn82jifha.html |title=Ajith’s 'Arrambam' shoot complete |publisher=Sify |date=2 October 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} Cinematographer Om Prakash stated that he wanted to give the visuals a "green tint because the colour 'green' is commonly associated with prosperity and knowledge".{{cite web|author=Udhav Naig |url=http://www.thehindu.com/features/cinema/viewfinder/article5251337.ece |title=Viewfinder |work=The Hindu|date=19 October 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} He also added that some scenes featuring Ajith were intendedly shot so that the audience would see both him and his reflection and that [[hand-held camera]]s were used to shoot those scenes from close "not because it would look fancy, but the script demanded such an approach". He described the speed boat stunt where Ajith Kumar performed a 180-degree turn at high speed as risky and "scary" as he filmed the entire scene seated at the front of the boat. Post-production works on the film started by mid 2013, and were carried out simultaneously with the shoot.{{cite news|agency=TNN |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-06-03/news-interviews/39713224_1_thala-53-full-swing-film |title=Thala 53 post production work on full swing |work=The Times of India|date=3 June 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}}{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/last-schedule-of-ajith-vishnuvardhan-film-news-tamil-ngxl6rbaddc.html |title=Last schedule of Ajith- Vishnuvardhan film |publisher=Sify |date=23 June 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} Rekhs worked on the subtitles of the film.{{cite news|agency=TNN |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-10-11/news-interviews/42940578_1_upcoming-film-arrambam-titling-rekhs |title=Rekhs does the sub-titling for Arrambam |work=The Times of India|date=11 October 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} By September 2013, the actors were [[Dubbing (filmmaking)|dubbing]] for their roles in Mumbai.{{cite web|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-09-29/news-interviews/42502030_1_ajith-arrambam-veeram |title=Ajith dubs in Mumbai, will shoot in Pune next |work=The Times of India|date=29 September 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} In October 2013, Yuvan Shankar Raja was working on the [[Re-recording (filmmaking)|re-recording]], while [[Digital intermediate]] works were in the "final stages".{{cite news|agency=TNN |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-10-14/news-interviews/43025436_1_arrambam-final-stages-diwali-release |title=Arrambam in final stages |work=The Times of India|date=14 October 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} ==Music== {{main|Arrambam (soundtrack)}} Yuvan Shankar Raja was signed on to compose the film's soundtrack and score, continuing his association with [[Vishnuvardhan (director)|Vishnuvardhan]] and [[Ajith Kumar]]. The soundtrack album consists of five tracks; notably a [[theme music]] track was not included,{{cite news|agency=TNN |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-09-14/news-interviews/42061688_1_arrambam-thala-fans-ajith |title=No theme track in Arrambam |work=The Times of India|date=14 September 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}}{{cite web|url=http://behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-news-10/arrambam-aka-aarambam-doesnt-have-a-theme-music-track-listing.html |title=Arrambam (aka) Aarambam doesn't have a theme music track listing |publisher=Behindwoods |date=13 September 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} which was composed only later during the re-recording.{{cite web|url=http://behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-news-13/the-theme-music-track-of-arrambam-aka-aarambam-may-be-released-as-a-single.html |title=The theme music track of Arrambam (aka) Aarambam may be released as a single |publisher=Behindwoods |date=22 October 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} [[Pa. Vijay]] penned the lyrics for all songs. It was released directly to stores on 19 September 2013 and opened at number one on [[iTunes Store|iTunes India]] after its release at midnight,{{cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.in/articles/507269/20130919/arrambam-ajith-audio-release-yuvan-thala-music.htm |title=Ajith's 'Arrambam' Audio Released – International Business Times |publisher=Ibtimes.co.in |date=19 September 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}}{{cite web|author=Ramchander |url=http://entertainment.oneindia.in/tamil/news/2013/arrambam-fans-music-review-120216.html |title=Arrambam – Fans' Music Review|publisher=Oneindia Entertainment |date=19 September 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} which, according to [[Sify]], "no Tamil album has done before".{{cite web | url=http://www.sify.com/movies/ajiths-arrambam-audio-opens-at-number-one-news-tamil-njtleBcgbgc.html | title=Ajith’s 'Arrambam' audio opens at number one! | publisher=Sify | accessdate=7 November 2013}} It also received positive reviews from critics.{{cite web|url=http://behindwoods.com/tamil-movies/arrambam/arrambam-songs-review.html |title=Arrambam Songs Review Arrambam, Ajith, Yuvan Shankar Raja |publisher=Behindwoods |accessdate=20 September 2013}}{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/musicreview/15849.html |title=Arrambam Music Review songs lyrics |publisher=IndiaGlitz |accessdate=20 September 2013}} ==Release== The satellite rights of the film were sold to [[Jaya TV]]. In early September 2013, producer A. M. Ratnam officially announced that the film would release for the [[Diwali]] festival.{{cite news|agency=TNN |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-09-03/news-interviews/41725568_1_am-rathnam-has-ajith-siruthai-siva |title=Ajith's 'Arrambam' to hit screens for Diwali |work=The Times of India|date=3 September 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} It was advanced by two days as the makers wanted the film to release on a Thursday.{{cite web|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-10-15/news-interviews/43065022_1_arrambam-audio-release-director-vishnuvardhan |title=Ajith's Arrambam has a Thursday sentiment |work=The Times of India|date=15 October 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} On 18 October 2013 the film was given a "U" (Universal) certificate by the [[Indian Censor Board]].{{cite news|agency=TNN |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-10-18/news-interviews/43177169_1_arrambam-veeram-ajith |title=Ajith's Arrambam cleared with 'U' |work=The Times of India|date=18 October 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} The [[British Board of Film Classification]] issued an uncut [[15 (British Board of Film Classification)|15 certificate]] with an advice that it "contains strong threat and violence".{{cite web|url=http://www.bbfc.co.uk/releases/aarambam-film |title=AARAMBAM | British Board of Film Classification |publisher=Bbfc.co.uk |date=25 October 2013 |accessdate=31 October 2013}} At the request of the distributor, cuts of five minutes length were made, obtaining a 12A certificate for the cut version.{{cite web|url=http://www.bbfc.co.uk/releases/aarambam-film-0 {{Use dmy dates|date=May 2017}} {{Use British English|date=May 2017}} '''Babtie, Shaw and Morton''' was a firm of [[civil engineering|civil engineer]]s based in [[Glasgow]], Scotland, and noted for its work on [[bridge]]s, [[dam]]s and [[reservoir]]s. It took its name following the 1906 merger of Babtie & Bonn (a partnership founded by John Babtie and Carl Bonn in 1897) and Shaw & Morton (founded by William Shaw and Hugh Morton).<ref>''Babtie, Shaw & Morton'', Dictionary of Scottish Architects, 2008, http://www.scottisharchitects.org.uk/architect_full.php?id=100563</ref><ref>''John Taylor Babtie'', Dictionary of Scottish Architects, 2008, http://www.scottisharchitects.org.uk/architect_full.php?id=100564</ref>
Notable design projects include the [[Backwater Reservoir]], [[Kielder Water]],<ref>North Tyne, Kielder Reservoir http://www.bridgesonthetyne.co.uk/kdr.html</ref> and the [[Harland and Wolff]] shipbuilding dock in [[Belfast]].
[[James Arthur Banks]] and [[William George Nicholson Geddes]] both became President of the [[Institution of Civil Engineers]] while partners in the firm.
The Babtie Group acquired consulting engineers Harris & Sutherland in 1997, then also Allott & Lomax in 2000.<ref>http://www.nce.co.uk/allott-and-lomax-deal-fills-gap-in-babtie-portfolio/818923.article</ref>
The 3,500-strong Babtie Group was acquired by [[Jacobs Engineering Group]] in August 2004.<ref>''Jacobs buys Babtie consultancy for £90m'', Financial Times, 16 August 2004 - http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/2d0cbf2e-f112-11d8-95b8-00000e2511c8.html#axzz1jTSLEMxI</ref>
Gordon Masterton, a director of Babtie from 1993 became the firm's third President of the [[Institution of Civil Engineers]] in 2005 whilst a Vice President of Jacobs.<ref>{{Citation | last = Masterton | first = Gordon | author-link = | title = ICE Presidential Address | date = | year = 2005 | url = http://www.icevirtuallibrary.com/doi/abs/10.1680/cien.2006.159.2.55 | accessdate = 29 January 2016}}</ref> ==References== <References />

'''Camuliana''', '''Camulia''' or '''Kamoulia''' was an ancient town or perhaps village in [[Cappadocia]], located northwest of Caesarea, today [[Kayseri]] in [[Turkey]]. It is mostly mentioned in connection with the '''Image of Camuliana''', an ''[[acheiropoieton]]'' or "icon not made by hands" of the face of [[Christ]], which was one of the earliest of this class of miraculously created icons to be recorded; this is also sometimes referred to simply as the "'''Camouliana'''".<ref>Beckwith, 88; Mango, 114-115</ref>
== Bishopric ==
The [[episcopal see]] of Camuliana is of relatively late origin, since it did not yet exist in the time of [[Basil the Great]] 329–379. However, four of its bishops are named in the acts of various councils: Basil in the [[Second Council of Constantinople]] (553); a George in the [[Third Council of Constantinople]] (680); another George in the [[Second Council of Nicaea]] (787); and a third George in the [[Photius|Photian]] [[Council of Constantinople (879)]].<ref>Michel Lequien, [https://books.google.com/books?id=0agp0mJFG_sC&printsec=frontcover#v=onepage&q&f=false ''Oriens christianus in quatuor Patriarchatus digestus''], Paris 1740, Vol. I, coll. 393-394</ref><ref>Pius Bonifacius Gams, [http://www.wbc.poznan.pl/dlibra/doccontent?id=65154&dirids=1 ''Series episcoporum Ecclesiae Catholicae''], Leipzig 1931, p. 440</ref> A seal indicates that there was also a bishop named Michael in the 10th or 11th century.
No longer a residential bishopric, Camuliana is today listed by the [[Catholic Church]] as a [[titular see]].<ref>''Annuario Pontificio 2013'' (Libreria Editrice Vaticana 2013 {{ISBN|978-88-209-9070-1}}), p. 857</ref>
==Image of Camuliana== The image of Christ that appears in Camuliana is mentioned in the early 6th century by [[Zacharias Rhetor]], his account surviving in a fragmentary [[Syriac language|Syriac]] version, and is probably the earliest image to be said to be a miraculous imprint on cloth in the style of the [[Veil of Veronica]] (a much later legend) or [[Shroud of Turin]]. In the version recorded in Zacharias's chronicle, a pagan lady called Hypatia was undergoing Christian instruction, and asking her instructor "How can I worship him, when He is not visible, and I cannot see Him?". She later found in her garden a painted image of Christ floating on water. When placed inside her head-dress for safekeeping it then created a second image onto the cloth, and then a third was painted. Hypatia duly converted and founded a church for the version of the image that remained in Camuliana. In the reign of [[Justinian I]] (527-565) the image is said to have been processed around cities in the region to protect them from barbarian attacks.<ref>Start of Book 12 of "Chronicle", pp. 425-427; Mango, 114-115</ref> This account differs from others but would be the earliest if it has not suffered from [[iconodule]] additions, as may be the case.<ref>Chronicle, 425-427, various notes</ref>
One of the images (if there was more than one) probably arrived in [[Constantinople]] in 574,<ref>The date is von Dobschütz's conclusion, and the subject of long discussion at Chronicle, 425, note, as some have disagreed.</ref> and is assumed to be the image of Christ used as a [[palladium (protective image)|palladium]] in subsequent decades, being paraded before the troops before battles by [[Philippicus (general)|Philippikos]], [[Priscus (general)|Priscus]] and [[Heraclius]], and in the [[Avars (Carpathians)|Avar]] [[Siege of Constantinople (626)|Siege of Constantinople in 626]], and praised as the cause of victory in poetry by [[George Pisida]], again very early mentions of this use of icons.<ref>Kitzinger, 111-112; Emerick, 356-357</ref> It was probably destroyed during the [[Byzantine Iconoclasm]],<ref>Beckwith, 88</ref> after which mentions of an existing image cease (however Heinrich Pfeiffer identifies it with the [[Veil of Veronica]] and [[Manoppello Image]] <ref>Heinrich Pfeiffer, ''The concept of “acheiropoietos”,the iconography of the face of Christ and the veil of Manoppello'', Proceedings of the International Workshop on the Scientific approach to the Acheiropoietos Images, ENEA Frascati, Italy, 4‐6 May 2010 [http://www.acheiropoietos.info/proceedings/PfeifferWeb.pdf]</ref>), and in later centuries its place was taken by the [[Image of Edessa]], which apparently arrived in Constantinople in 944, and icons of the [[Theotokos]] such as the [[Hodegetria]]. The Image of Edessa was very probably later, but had what apparently seemed to the Byzantines an even more impressive [[provenance]], as it was thought to have been an authentic non-miraculous portrait painted from the life during the lifetime of Jesus.

{{Infobox writer | name = Carolina Coronado | image = Carolina Coronado, por Federico de Madrazo.jpg | imagesize = | caption = Carolina Coronado | birth_name = Victoria Carolina Coronado y Romero de Tejada | birth_date = December 12, 1820 | birth_place = [[Almendralejo]], [[Spain]] | death_date = January 15, 1911 | death_place = [[Lisbon]], [[Portugal]] | occupation = writer, poet | nationality = Spanish | period = | genre = [[Romanticism in Spanish literature|Romanticism]] | movement = | notableworks = | spouse = Horacio Justo Perry | partner = Alberto | children = 3 | relatives = [[Ramón Gómez de la Serna]] | awards = | signature = }} {{Spanish name|Coronado|Romero de Tejada}} '''Victoria Carolina Coronado y Romero de Tejada''' (December 12, 1820 – January 15, 1911) was a [[Spain|Spanish]] author considered the equivalent of contemporary [[Romanticism|Romantic]] authors like [[Rosalía de Castro]]. She became so popular as to merit the title "the female [[Gustavo Adolfo Bécquer|Bécquer]]."
==Youth== Victoria Carolina Coronado y Romero de Tejada was born on 12 December 1820 in [[Almendralejo]], [[Badajoz]] in the province of [[Extremadura]]. She was the daughter of Nicolás Coronado y Gallardo and María Antonia Romero de Tejada y Falcón. Her family was well-to-do, but they adhered to a progressive ideology that caused her father and grandfather to be persecuted. After moving to the [[province|provincial]] capital of Badajoz, Carolina received the formal education for girls of her time: fashion and housework. Despite this, she demonstrated at an early age an interest in [[literature]], and she began to read works from widely varying genres. Thanks to this activity she gained a natural ability to compose verses. Her earliest poems were written when she was 10 years old. Though she employed somewhat sloppy language and committed grammatical errors, her lines were spontaneous and charged with feeling. Many of her poems were based on impossible loves. Her most notable subject was Alberto - who may not even have existed.
Her romantic temperament could also have been influenced by the chronic [[catalepsy]] from which she suffered. She even appeared to "die" on several occasions, leading her to become obsessed with death. She would eventually [[embalming|embalm]] her deceased husband, refusing to bury him, and she even had several "premonitions" in which she predicted the deaths of her children.
==Life in Madrid== After taking a vow of abstinence after the death of Alberto Tejada at sea (whether he was real or imaginary), she revoked the vow when she married sir Horacio Justo Perry in [[Madrid]] in 1852. Perry was the secretary of the [[United States|American]] [[embassy]].
Coronado had a revolutionary spirit, and she became famous while living in Madrid for the literary salons she held. Her gatherings served as a meeting-point for progressive writers and a refuge for the persecuted, including many of the most well-known authors of the time. Unfortunately for her, her clandestine refuge and affinity for revolution brought about the disapproval of her contemporaries.
Despite this, she succeeded in publishing several works in newspapers and magazines and thus gained a certain measure of fame. Her physical beauty undoubtedly contributed to her success, and it caused infamous admiration in other romantic writers. In fact, [[José de Espronceda]] dedicated the following verses to her: {{Verse translation| {{lang|es|Dicen que tienes trece primaveras y eres portento de hermosura ya, y que en tus grandes ojos reverberas la lumbre de los astros inmortal.}} | They say that you have thirteen springs and you are a vision of beauty and that in your great eyes reverberates the glow of the immortal stars.}}
Coronado died in [[Lisbon]], [[Portugal]] on 15 January 1911.
[[File:Monument à Carolina Coronado (Almendralejo).JPG|thumb|Monument to Coronado in [[Almendralejo]]]]
==Work==
The main body of Coronado's work was [[lyric poetry]]. Her poems adopted diverse themes, including patriotic sentiment in ''¡Oh, mi España!''; religion in ''El amor de los amores'' and ''¿Cómo, Señor, no he de tenerte miedo?''; and especially [[Romanticism]] in poems such as ''A una gota de rocío'', '' A la rosa blanca'', ''Nada resta de tí'', ''¡Oh! cuál te adoro'', ''A una estrella'', and ''A las nubes''. Her prolific works were compiled in a single volume entitled ''Poesías'', published in 1843 and re-edited in 1852, that includes a prologue by [[Juan Eugenio Hartzenbusch]].
In prose, she wrote a total of fifteen novels including ''Luz'', ''El bonete de San Ramón'', ''La Siega'', ''Jarrilla'', ''La rueda de la desgracia'' (1873), and ''Paquita'' (1850). Many critics consider the last to be the best. She also authored several plays like ''El cuadro de la esperanza'' (1846), ''Alfonso IV de León'', ''Un alcalde de monterilla'', and ''El divino Figueroa'', but these endeavors are considered minor in comparison to her non-theatrical works.
==External links== *[http://www.escritoras.com/escritoras/escritora.php?i=22 Writers.com in spanish]

revision.text:
The following is a '''list of unproduced [[Darren Aronofsky]] projects''' in roughly chronological order. During his long career, American film director Darren Aronofsky has worked on a number of projects which never progressed beyond the pre-production stage under his direction. Some of these projects fell in [[development hell]] or were cancelled.
== 1990s == === ''Ronin'' === Eleven days after the release of ''[[Pi (film)|Pi]]'', his first film, Aronofsky signed a deal with [[New Line Cinema]] in July 1998 to direct a film adaptation of [[Frank Miller (comics)|Frank Miller]]'s ''[[Ronin (DC Comics)|Ronin]]'' comic book series.<ref>{{cite web|author=Benedict Carver,Dan Cox |url=https://variety.com/1998/film/news/aronofsky-draws-on-comic-1117478663/ |title=Aronofsky draws on comic |publisher=Variety |date=1998-07-21 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> [[Frank Miller (comics)|Frank Miller]], the author of the comic book, was attached to write the script.<ref>{{cite web|last=Linder |first=Brian |url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2000/10/16/the-bat-men-speak |title=The Bat-Men Speak |publisher=IGN |date=2000-10-16 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> However, the project never materialized and Aronofsky left it to direct ''[[Requiem for a Dream]]''.
== 2000s == === ''Sector 7'' === On May 24, 2000, Aronofsky was announced to direct a film adaptation of [[David Wiesner]]'s ''[[Sector 7#Film adaptation|Sector 7]]'' for [[Nickelodeon Movies]]. Eric Watson was attached to produce the film. However, the project finally fell into [[development hell]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.corona.bc.ca/films/details/sector7.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20010410070243/http://www.corona.bc.ca/films/details/sector7.html |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2001-04-10 |title=Coming Attractions |date= |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> and Aronofsky moved to other projects.
=== ''Batman: Year One'' === On September 21, 2000, ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' reported that Aronofsky had signed a deal with [[Warner Bros.]] to direct a fifth [[Batman]] film based on [[Frank Miller (comics)|Frank Miller]]'s acclaimed comic book ''[[Batman: Year One]]'', with Miller attached to write the script, with Eric Watson attached to produce and with Aronofsky's frequent collaborator [[Matthew Libatique]] to work on it.<ref>{{cite web|author=Dana Harris |url=https://variety.com/2000/film/news/wb-sends-pi-guy-into-the-bat-cave-1117786714/ |title=WB sends ‘Pi’ guy into the Bat Cave |publisher=Variety |date=2000-09-21 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=Andrew O. Thompson |url=https://variety.com/2000/film/news/matthew-libatique-1117788894/ |title=Matthew Libatique |publisher=Variety |date=2000-11-07 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> The film was intended to be a [[reboot (fiction)|reboot]] of the [[Batman (1989 film series)|film series]],<ref name="autogenerated2000">{{cite web|last=Linder |first=Brian |url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2000/12/06/aronofsky-talks-batman-year-oneagain |title=Aronofsky Talks Batman: Year One...Again |publisher=IGN |date=2000-12-06 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> after the failure of ''[[Batman & Robin (film)|Batman & Robin]]'' in 1997, although [[Warner Bros.]] originally planned to release the film as a prequel of [[Tim Burton]]'s ''[[Batman (1989 film)|Batman]]''.<ref name="autogenerated2000"/> [[Christian Bale]], who later portrayed [[Batman]] in [[Christopher Nolan]]'s ''[[The Dark Knight Trilogy]]'' was attached to star in the lead role.<ref>{{cite news|author= Adam Smith|title= The Original ''American Psycho''|work= [[Empire (magazine)|Empire]]|date= July 2005|pages= 74–80, 82, 84, 87}}</ref> [[Gillian B. Loeb]] was supposed to be the main antagonist of the film, replacing [[Carmine Falcone]] as the head of [[Gotham City]]'s mafia.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://leonscripts.users5.50megs.com/scripts/BATMANYEARONEscript.htm |title=BATMAN YEAR ONE By Frank Miller |website=Leonscripts.users5.50megs.com |date= |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> Aronofsky also planned to film the movie in [[Ciudad Vieja, Montevideo]], [[Uruguay]].<ref>{{cite web|last=McKnight |first=Brent |url=http://www.cinemablend.com/new/Why-Darren-Aronofsky-Batman-Movie-Never-Happened-According-Frank-Miller-116237.html |title=Why Darren Aronofsky's Batman Movie Never Happened, According To Frank Miller |publisher=Cinemablend |date=2016-03-04 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> However, on June 30, 2002, Aronofsky and Miller finally left the project due to other commitments.<ref>{{cite web|author=Dana Harris |url=https://variety.com/2002/film/news/wb-fewer-pix-more-punch-1117869140/ |title=WB: fewer pix, more punch |publisher=Variety |date=2002-06-30 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> A [[Reboot (fiction)|reboot]] of the [[Batman (1989 film series)|''Batman'' film series]] was finally released in 2005 as ''[[Batman Begins]]'' and directed by [[Christopher Nolan]].
=== ''Flicker'' === On January 28, 2003, Aronofsky was reported to direct a film adaptation of [[Theodore Roszak (scholar)|Theodore Roszak]]'s [[Flicker (novel)#Film adaptation|novel ''Flicker'']].<ref>{{cite web|author=Dana Harris |url=https://variety.com/2003/film/markets-festivals/regency-new-home-for-pi-guy-1117879646/ |title=Regency new home for ‘Pi’ guy |publisher=Variety |date=2003-01-28 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.filmcomment.com/article/unproduced-and-unfinished-films-a-ongoing-film-comment-project/ |title=Unproduced and Unfinished Films: An Ongoing Film Comment project |publisher=Film Comment |date=2015-04-07 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> ''[[Fight Club]]'' [[screenwriter]] [[Jim Uhls]] was attached to write the script.<ref>{{cite web|author=Dana Harris |url=https://variety.com/2003/film/markets-festivals/hard-time-for-fight-duo-1117892678/ |title=‘Hard’ time for ‘Fight’ duo |publisher=Variety |date=2003-09-18 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> However, on February 15, 2006, ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' reported that Aronofsky left the project and moved to [[Universal Studios]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Gabriel Snyder |url=https://variety.com/2006/film/features/pi-guy-getting-into-u-1117938319/ |title=‘Pi’ guy getting into U |publisher=Variety |date=2006-02-15 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref>
=== ''Watchmen'' === In July 2004, Aronofsky was hired by [[Paramount Pictures]] to direct a [[Watchmen (film)|film adaptation of ''Watchmen'']], with [[David Hayter]] as writer (who wrote the script in October 2001)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ign.com/movies |title=Movie Reviews, Trailers, Interviews, Wikis & Posters for Movies |publisher=IGN |date= |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> and with [[Lawrence Gordon (producer)|Lawrence Gordon]], [[Lloyd Levin]] and Eric Watson as producers.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/thr/film/brief_display.jsp?vnu_content_id=1000584187 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060105145306/http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/thr/film/brief_display.jsp?vnu_content_id=1000584187 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2006-01-05 |title=Hollywoodreporter.com |date= |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> However, at the end, Aronofsky left the project due to scheduling contracts with ''[[The Fountain]]''.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/thr/film/brief_display.jsp?vnu_content_id=1000724534 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2006-09-23 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5mqgGAdta?url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/thr/film/brief_display.jsp?vnu_content_id=1000724534 |archivedate=2010-01-17 |df= }}</ref> The film was eventually released in 2009 directed by [[Zack Snyder]].
=== ''The Fighter'' === On March 26, 2007, Aronofsky announced that he was attached to direct ''[[The Fighter]]'', a biographical film based on the life of [[professional boxer]] [[Micky Ward]].<ref>{{cite web|author1=Pamela McClintock |author2=Michael Fleming |url=https://variety.com/2007/film/markets-festivals/aronofsky-in-talks-to-direct-fighter-2-1117961861/ |title=Aronofsky in talks to direct ‘Fighter’ |publisher=Variety |date=2007-03-26 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> [[Scott Silver]] was attached to write the script.<ref>{{cite web|author1=Michael Fleming |author2=Tatiana Siegel |url=https://variety.com/2007/film/features/brad-pitt-laces-up-for-fighter-2-1117972382/ |title=Brad Pitt laces up for ‘Fighter’ |publisher=Variety |date=2007-09-20 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> However, on July 25, 2008, [[Collider (website)|Collider]] reported that Aronofsky left the project in favor of directing the [[RoboCop (2014 film)|''RoboCop'' remake]].<ref name="collider1">{{cite web|author=Steve 'Frosty' Weintraub |url=http://collider.com/its-official-darren-aronofsky-will-build-a-better-robocop/ |title=It's Official! Darren Aronofsky Will Build A Better ROBOCOP |publisher=Collider |date=2008-07-25 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> The film was finally released in 2010 and directed by [[David O. Russell]].
=== ''RoboCop'' === On July 9, 2008, [[The Hollywood Reporter]] reported that [[MGM]] was in talks with Aronofsky to direct the long time planned ''[[RoboCop]]'' remake<ref>{{cite web|last=Fernandez |first=Jay A. |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/hr/content_display/film/news/e3i2a7c68761043a405a4f5c48c0666d28e |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080710131402/http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/hr/content_display/film/news/e3i2a7c68761043a405a4f5c48c0666d28e |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2008-07-10 |title=MGM likes 'Dawn' at the 'Cabin' |date=2008-07-09 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> that was first announced in 2005. Sixteen days later, it was announced during the [[San Diego Comic-Con International]] 2008 that Aronofsky would direct the film with [[David Self]] attached to write it,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://filmjunk.com/2008/07/25/comic-con-rumour-control-aronosky-on-robocop-ratner-on-god-of-war-proyas-off-silver-surfer/ |title=Comic Con Rumour Control: Aronosky on Robocop, Ratner on God of War, Proyas off Silver Surfer |publisher=Film Junk |date=2008-07-25 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> leaving the production of [[Paramount Pictures]]' ''[[The Fighter]]''.<ref name="collider1"/> On June 12, 2009, it was reported that the film would be released in 2011.<ref>{{cite web|author=Gary Susman |url=http://io9.gizmodo.com/5288733/aronofskys-robocop-delayed-until-2011 |title=Aronofsky's Robocop Delayed Until 2011 |website=Io9.gizmodo.com |date= |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> However, in July 2009, during the [[San Diego Comic-Con]], [[MGM]] reported that the project was slowing down due scheduling conflicts with Aronofsky.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.slashfilm.com/mgm-looking-for-a-new-robocop-director-searchlight-wants-aronofskys-black-swan/ |title=MGM Looking For A New Robocop Director? Searchlight Wants Aronofsky's Black Swan - /Film |website=Slashfilm.com |date=2009-07-15 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> Finally, on March 2, 2011, it was reported by [[Internet Movie Database]] that Brazilian director [[José Padilha]] would direct the film instead of Aronofsky.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/news/ni8195625/|title=Jose Padilha in Talks to Direct Robocop Remake|website=IMDb.com|accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> The film was finally released in 2014 and directed by Padilha.
== 2010s == === ''Superman'' === On September 28, 2010, [[MTV News]] reported that Aronofsky was in talks with [[Warner Bros.]] to direct a [[Reboot (fiction)|reboot]] of the [[Superman in film|''Superman'' film series,]] after the not so good reception of ''[[Superman Returns]]'' in 2006.<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/2597504/darren-aronofsky-superman-reboot/ |title=Darren Aronofsky Rumored For 'Superman' Reboot |publisher=MTV |date=2010-09-28 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> However, Aronofsky refused to direct it due his commitment with ''[[#The Wolverine|Wolverine 2]]''.<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1725078/darren-aronofsky-superman/ |title=Darren Aronofsky 'Absolutely' Wanted To Direct 'Man Of Steel' |publisher=MTV |date=2014-03-31 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> A [[reboot (fiction)|reboot]] of the [[Superman in film|''Superman'' film series]] was finally released in 2013 as ''[[Man of Steel (film)|Man of Steel]]'' and directed by [[Zack Snyder]].
=== ''The Wolverine'' === On October 13, 2010, [[SuperHeroHype.com]] reported that Aronofsky was in talks with [[20th Century Fox]] to direct ''[[The Wolverine (film)|Wolverine 2]]'', the sixth entry of the [[X-Men (film series)|''X-Men'' film series]] that started with ''[[X-Men (film)|X-Men]]'' and the planned sequel of [[Gavin Hood]]'s poorly-received film ''[[X-Men Origins: Wolverine]]'',<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.superherohype.com/news/108795-darren-aronosfky-in-talks-for-wolverine-2 |title=Darren Aronofsky in Talks for Wolverine 2 |publisher=SuperHeroHype |date=2010-10-13 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> after ''[[X-Men (film)|X-Men]]'' director [[Bryan Singer]] turned down the offer of direct it in March 2010.<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://herocomplex.latimes.com/movies/bryan-singer-and-the-xmen-together-again/ |title=Bryan Singer on ‘X-Men: First Class’: It’s got to be about Magneto and Professor X | Hero Complex – movies, comics, pop culture – Los Angeles Times |website=Herocomplex.latimes.com |date=2010-03-18 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> Seven days later, [[Hugh Jackman]] confirmed via [[Vulture.com]] that Aronofsky would direct the film.<ref>{{cite web|author=What to Stream Now |url=http://www.vulture.com/2010/10/hugh_jackman_promises_aronofsk.html |title=Hugh Jackman Promises Aronofsky’s Wolverine 2 Will Be ‘Thoughtful,’ ‘Meaty’ |publisher=Vulture |date= |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> On November 13, 2010, Aronofsky confirmed via Upprox that the film would be titled now ''The Wolverine''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://uproxx.com/hitfix/darren-aronofsky-confirms-a-new-title-for-wolverine-2/ |title=Darren Aronofsky confirms a new title for ‘Wolverine 2’ |website=Uproxx.com |date= |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> However, on March 17, 2011, ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' reported that Aronofsky left the project because directing would have meant that he had to leave his country for a long time and be away from his family.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/darren-aronofsky-bows-as-wolverine-168827 |title=Darren Aronofsky Bows Out as 'Wolverine' Director |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=2011-03-17 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> The film was finally released in 2013 and directed by [[James Mangold]].
=== ''Hobgoblin'' === On March 16, 2011, one day before announcing his departure from ''[[#The Wolverine|The Wolverine]]'' film, Aronofsky reported via ''[[Deadline Hollywood]]'' that he would direct the pilot of a planned TV series entitled ''Hobgoblin'' for [[HBO]]. The series would have focused on the adventures of a group of magicians and con artists who use their powers of deception to defeat [[Adolf Hitler]] during [[World War II]]. [[Pulitzer Prize]]-winning author [[Michael Chabon]] and Chabon's wife Ayelet Waldman were attached to work on the project.<ref>{{cite web|last=Andreeva |first=Nellie |url=http://deadline.com/2011/06/darren-aronofsky-joins-magic-world-war-ii-drama-series-in-development-at-hbo-140780/ |title=Darren Aronofsky Joins Magic World War II Drama Series In Development At HBO |website=Deadline Hollywood |date=2011-06-16 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> However, [[Screen Crush]] reported on June 18, 2013 that Aronofsky was pulled out from the project.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://screencrush.com/hbo-hobgoblin-darren-aronofsky-magic/ |title=HBO Passes on Darren Aronofsky WW2 Magic Drama 'Hobgoblin,' FX Reportedly Considers |website=Screencrush.com |date=2013-06-18 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref>
=== ''Red Sparrow'' === On August 14, 2013, Deadline.com reported that Aronofsky was in talks to direct a [[Red Sparrow|film adaptation]] of Jason Matthews' spy novel ''[[Red Sparrow (book)|Red Sparrow]]'',<ref>{{cite web|last=Fleming |first=Mike |url=http://deadline.com/2013/08/darren-aronofsky-in-talks-for-fox-espionage-tale-red-sparrow-564038/ |title=Darren Aronofsky In Talks For Fox Espionage Tale ‘Red Sparrow’ |website=Deadline Hollywood |date=2013-08-14 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> with [[Eric Warren Singer]] attached to write its script.<ref>{{cite web|author=Oliver Lyttelton |url=http://www.indiewire.com/2014/09/from-a-z-a-guide-to-the-lost-unmade-films-of-david-fincher-271772/ |title=From A-Z: A Guide To The Lost & Unmade Films Of David Fincher |publisher=[[IndieWire]] |date=2016-05-23 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> However, ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' later reported on January 16, 2014, that Aronofsky had abandoned the project.<ref>{{cite web|author=Borys Kit |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/darren-aronofsky-will-not-direct-671727 |title=Darren Aronofsky Will Not Direct 'Red Sparrow' |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=2014-01-16 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> On June 9, 2014, it was announced that [[David Fincher]] would direct the film, although no release date was announced at the moment.<ref>{{cite web|author=Rodrigo Perez |url=http://www.indiewire.com/2014/06/david-fincher-rooney-mara-possibly-reteaming-for-red-sparrow-adapted-by-american-hustle-screenwriter-85014/ |title=David Fincher & Rooney Mara Possibly Reteaming For ‘Red Sparrow’ Adapted By ‘American Hustle’ Screenwriter |publisher=[[IndieWire]] |date=2016-05-13 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> The film was eventually produced with [[Francis Lawrence]] directing.

{{about|the Indian comic book company|the American corporation|Diamond Comic Distributors}} {{more footnotes|date=April 2009}} {{Infobox company | name = Diamond Comics | type = [[Private company|Private]] | logo = | caption = | industry = [[Comics]] | founder = | foundation = | location = | homepage = }} '''Diamond Comics Pvt. Ltd.''' is a [[comic book]] [[Distribution (business)|distributor]] and [[publisher]] in India.
==Overview== Diamond Comics is responsible for popular Indian comics characters such as [[Chacha Chaudhary]]. Diamond Comics has been publishing many foreign characters comics such as Phantom, Superman, Batman, Spider-Man, and James Bond in [[Hindi]] in India. Diamond Comics is the publisher of characters of India's famous cartoonist; [[Pran Kumar Sharma]], better known as Pran.
== Major characters of Diamond Comics ==
===Cartoonist Pran's characters === * [[Chacha Chaudhary]], main characters: Chacha Chaudhary (Chachaji), Sabu (Chachaji's faithful assistant who has come from Jupiter), Bini (Chachaji's wife) Rocket (Chachaji's dog), Raakaa (a villain who drank an 'immortality' potion), Gobar Singh (a bandit), Dhamaka Singh (Gobar's aide) * [[Billoo]], main characters: Billoo, Joji, Gabdu, Bajrangi Pahalwan * [[Pinki (comics)|Pinki]], main characters: Pinki, Grandma, Grandpa, Champu, Jhapatji * Raman - a middle class office-worker, main characters: Raman, Kamli, Khalifa, Moga Singh, Office Boss * Shrimati Ji - a mid-class simple housewife * Daabu * Channi Chachi * Soni-Sampat - a mid-class young couple
=== Teamed-up characters === *[[Chacha Bhatija (cartoon series)|Chacha-Bhatija]] * Sunny Gill & the Agents of Sniff (based on [[Sniff (film)|Sniff]] film) (co-operation with [[Eros International|Eros]]'s [[Trinity Pictures]]) * Agniputra-Abhay * Tau Ji (with Rumjhum) * [[Motu-Patlu]] * Motu-Chhotu * Chhotu-Lamboo * Lamboo-Motu * Anderam-Danderam * Alturam-Falturam * Manglu Madari - Bander Bihari * Mama-Bhanja * Raajan-Iqbal * [[Fauladi Singh]] (with Lamboo, Dr. John) * Chacha Chaudhry (With Sabu)
=== Fun/family characters === * Ankur * Chimpoo * Paltoo * Meeku
=== Action figures === * Mahabali Shaka * Jasoos Chakram * Dynamite * Jimmy Hendricks
=== Foreign characters (licensed) === * [[Phantom (comics)|Phantom]] * [[Flash Gordon]] * [[Mandrake]] * [[James Bond]] * [[He-Man]] * [[Tarzan]] * [[Spider-Man]] * [[Superman]] * [[Batman]] * [[Archie]] * [[Garfield]]
===Advertisements/endorsement/TV series === * [[Shaktimaan]] (Based on the popular TV serial for children, Shaktimaan starring [[Mukesh Khanna]], an Indian Superhero.) * Rasna Genie ([[Rasna]] is one of the biggest drinks in India.) * [[Kapil Dev]] (Prithvi Ke Rakshak - Action Grahvasi) (Comic produce as an ad campaign for Action Shoes) * Big Babool Children (Distributed free with Perfetti's popular Big Babool Bubble Gum) * [[Captain Vyom]] (Comic version of a space adventure TV series of the same name starring [[Milind Soman]] in the title role)
=== 3D comics === * ''Diamond Comics 3D Series''
==Adaptation== In 2009, Diamond Comics, the owner of characters Chacha Chowdhary, Sabu and Pinki teamed up with License India, to bring them to silver screen as animation characters.<ref name="bl">{{cite news|url=http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/news/2009/02/27/12597/|title=Chacha Chowdhary, Pinki, Sabu to hit the silver screen soon|date=February 27, 2009|publisher=''[[Bollywood Hungama]]''}}</ref>

There has been much speculation over which paintings belonged to the work - there is now consensus that it consisted of six large canvases and a seventh, now lost. Five of those six canvases are now in the [[Prado]] and the sixth is in the [[National Museum of Art of Romania]] in Bucharest. ==History== == Composition == === Names, dimensions and museums === File:Resurreccion Prado.jpg|'''Resurrection'''

[[File:Carved supporting beam - The Old Wool Hall, Lavenham - geograph.org.uk - 1546714.jpg|thumb|Carved dragon post below a dragon beam - [[Lavenham Wool Hall|The Old Wool Hall, Lavenham]] - geograph.org.uk - 1546714]] [[File:Azerat chapelle charpente.JPG|thumb|The diagonal beams are dragon beams. Chapel of Our Lady of Good Hope, Azerat, France]] '''Dragon beam''' is a horizontal, diagonal [[Beam (structure)|beam]] in the corner(s) of some traditional [[Timber framing|timber framed]] buildings. The term is commonly used in both [[hip roof]] framing and [[jettying]]. Older publications may use the synonyms dragging beam, dragging piece, dragging tie, dragon piece or dragon tie. Inconsistencies in modern usage are discussed below. In French it is called a coyer or enrayure.
==Etymology== The etymology of dragon is unclear. The term may be descended from German [[:de:Träger|träger]] (a carrier), Danish [[:da:Gitterbro|dragere]] (bearing beam, joist, girder) or Dutch [[:nl:Bint (bouwkunde)|draagbalk]] (beam). The origin has also been proposed as a corruption of diagonal or diagon.<ref>Miles Lewis, "Puncheons and Dragons:Renaissance carpentry and semantics" http://www.mileslewis.net/lectures/04-history-of-building/puncheons-and-dragons.pdf accessed 3/22/2013</ref>
==Hip roofs== The dragon beam lies parallel to and below a hip rafter and carries the rafter. The dragon beam is carried by the wall on the outer end and by a horizontal piece between the two walls on the inside end. There are conflicting usages for this term in the U.K. and U.S.A. (see below). The most common usage seems to be combination dragon beam/cross tie. * A dragon beam lands on a dragon tie. (U.K.)<ref>Alcock, N. W.. Recording timber-framed buildings: an illustrated glossary. London: Council for British Archaeology, 1989. G6, G7.</ref> * A dragon tie lands on a cross-tie. (U.K.)<ref>Harris, Richard. Discovering timber-framed buildings. 2d ed. Aylesbury: Shire Publications, 1979. 94.</ref> * A dragon beam lands on a dragon tie. (U.S.A.)<ref>Timber Framing, “Timber Framing for Beginners: VI. Glossary of Terms”, 68:12 available online at http://tfguild.businesscatalyst.com/downloads/publications/Glossary-of-Timber-Framing-Terms.pdf</ref> * "Dragon strut, dragon piece, dragon tie, dragon beam", (French: coyer) lands on a "dragon cross tie" (French: gousset). (U.S.A.)<ref>Edwards, Jay Dearborn, and Nicolas Verton. A Creole lexicon architecture, landscape, people. Baton Rouge: Louisiana State University Press, 2004. 87.</ref> * A dragon-piece lands on an angle-tie (U.K.)<ref>Hewett, Cecil Alec. The development of carpentry, 1200-1700: an Essex study.. Newton Abbot: David & Charles, 1969. 9, 11.</ref>
==Jetties== In buildings with [[Jettying|jetties]] on adjacent walls the dragon beam is a horizontal, diagonal beam projecting from a corner which supports the jetties.<ref>Alcock, N. W.. Recording timber-framed buildings: an illustrated glossary. London: Council for British Archaeology, 1989.</ref> Sometimes the post below the dragon beam is called a dragon post.<ref>Harris, Richard. Discovering timber-framed buildings. 2d ed. Aylesbury: Shire Publications, 1979. 56.</ref>

<!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:Nyitokepp.jpg|thumb|right|200px]] --> {{eastern name order|Keresztes Dóra}} '''Dóra Keresztes''' (born October 3, 1953, [[Budapest]]) [[Hungarian people|Hungarian]] [[Painting|painter]], printmaker, [[illustrator]], [[graphic designer]] and [[animated film director]].
==Biography==
She graduated from the [[Moholy-Nagy University of Art and Design|Hungarian University of Arts And Design]]) in Budapest as pupil of [[István Balogh (director)|István Balogh]], [[György Haiman]], [[János Kass]] and [[Ernő Rubik]]. She started her career with book designs and illustrations mainly for children and contemporary [[Hungarian literature]]. Later on the film and theater posters came to the center of her interest and she was art director and designer of the „Muses” Cultural Magazine in Budapest. Beside her design activity she is an independent fine artist, stage designer and director of animated films. Her works have been shown in exhibitions, biennials and film festivals both in Hungary and abroad. Vice president of the Society of Hungarian Illustrators, film director in [[PannóniaFilm]] Studio, co-founder of [[Hungarian Poster Society]]. She works as a freelance designer in her own design studio.
==Her art==
<!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:Jatekok13.jpg|thumb|right|320px|Dóra Keresztes: Toys]] --> Determining the coordinates of the creation of Dora Keresztes is especially helped by the artistic and thematic and technical constants of her works. There is a number of them and since the fundamental ones migrate between the individual fields of activity parallelly attended to by Keresztes, they mutually transform and the generic plasticity and imagination of these fields. The origin of her linocuts were probably the woodcuts of the middle age, the world of "[[Biblia Pauperum]]" ("Paupers' Bible") which became so popular by the designers and fine artists of expressionist movement in the beginning of the 20th century too. Also her works were deeply influenced by the simplicity of East European [[folk art]]. She made study in Hungarian and Rumenian ([[Transilvania]]n) villages observing the decoration of small old churches. She does preach that traditional forms and handmade constructions could exist further and they can be part of the contemporary art and modern design as well. She likes to travel between the past and the present and in her pictures the world keeps her totality as it was in the time of the ancient mythologies and as it is in the tales and fables. We can observe her attraction towards the grotesque and [[surrealism]] too. Especially in her colorful animated films we can feel the presence of the dreams, subconscious and imagination. In some of her design works – especially in the case of posters and logos appears the influence of the emblematic power of [[folk art]] what is mixed with the more rigorous geometrical approach. She likes using the different forms of [[symmetry]] too and she plays very often with the rhythm of positive and negative forms. The world of Dora Keresztes is rather unusual in the digital field of the contemporary design life, but she says that the fundament of the future is in the past. She knows the responsibility of the designer for the local cultures, and she does work to keep them, she works for a healthy coexistence.
== Exhibitions == <!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:Plakatterv.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Dóra Keresztes: Poster]] --> * 1985 Budapest, Vigadó Gallery *2000 Szeged, Kass Gallery *2001 Teheran, Artist Gallery *2005 Budapest, Dorottya Gallery *2005 Budapest, [[Hungarian National Theatre]] *2009 Budapest, Barabas Villa *2012 Moscow, State Children's Library *2012 Győr, Esterhazy Palace *2014 Hiroshima, Aster Plaza
==Animated films==
*1979 – Moon Film (Holdasfilm) (with [[István Orosz]]) *1985 – Magic (Garabonciák) (with [[István Orosz]]) *1989 – Golden Bird (Aranymadár) *1996 – Faces (Arcok) *2001 - Smiling Sad Willow Tree (Mosolygó szomorúfűz) *2002 - De profundis *2005 - One-Two-Three (Egyedem-begyedem)
==Stage design==

== Awards ==
*1977-2001 Main Prizes of the Beautiful Hungarian Book Competition (nine times) *1988 Award of the Biennial of Graphic Design, Brno *1994 The International Board on Books for Young People (IBBY) Award *2000 Gold Medal of the Millennium Competition of Hungarian Art Academy *2001 The International Board on Books for Young People (IBBY) Award

{{no footnotes|date=May 2016}} {{Infobox organization |image = |alt = |caption = |map = |motto = |formation = 1966 |extinction = |type = |status = |purpose = |headquarters = [[Florence]], [[Italy]] |coords = |language = |leader_title = |leader_name = |main_organ = |parent_organization = |affiliations = |budget = |remarks = |name = Flood Ladies |image_border = |size = |msize = |malt = |mcaption = |abbreviation = |location = |region_served = Worldwide |membership = |num_staff = |num_volunteers = |website = }} The '''Flood Ladies''' were a group of international female artists who contributed artworks to the city of Florence following the catastrophic [[1966 flood of the Arno]] as a sign of solidarity and to help repair the psychological damage done by the flood. The group was formed in [[Florence]], [[Italy]] in 1966. Contributors to the collection lived all over the world. In 2014 the organization Advancing Women Artist Foundation headed an effort to preserve, exhibit and acknowledge the contribution of these women.
==History== Following the devastating flooding that damaged and destroyed cultural treasures of Florence, Italy in 1966, while those losses can never be replaced, the generosity of some of Italy’s most significant women artists of the 20th century as well as distinguished painters and sculptors from around the world brought donations of hundreds of notable creative works to the city.
In 2014 the City of Florence opened the "Museum of the 1900s" to showcase these works.
The story of the Flood Ladies was chronicled in the 2014 book "When the World Answered. Florence, Women Artists and the 1966 Flood" and the 2015 PBS documentary of the same name.

[[File:HVogel-FrauHolle.JPG|thumb|upright|Frau Holle, illustration by [[Hermann Vogel (German illustrator)|Hermann Vogel]]]] "'''Frau Holle'''" (also known as "'''Mother Holle'''" or "'''Mother Hulda'''" or "'''Old Mother Frost'''") is a [[German language|German]] [[fairy tale]] that comes from the book ''Kinder- und Hausmärchen'' (''[[Children's and Household Tales]]'') collected by [[The Brothers Grimm|Jacob and Wilhelm Grimm]].<ref name=surlalune>{{cite web|title=Frau Holle (Mother Holle) (A German Tale)|url=http://www.surlalunefairytales.com/diamondstoads/stories/holle.html|website=SurLaLuneFairyTales.com|accessdate=1 April 2015}}</ref> "Frau Holle" is the 24th story in the first volume of the book published in 1812 as part of ''Children's and Household Tales''.
==Background== [[File:Vrouwholle.jpg|thumb|260px|Frau Holle in the [[Efteling]]]] The legend itself, as it was eventually passed to the Grimm Brothers, originates from oral traditions in [[Central Germany (cultural area)|Central Germany]] in what is now known as [[Hesse]]. It was told to them by Henriette Dorothea Wild (whom Wilhelm Grimm married in 1825) with more details, which were added in the second edition (1819). It is still a common expression in Hesse and beyond to say "Hulda is making her bed" when it is snowing, that is, she shakes her bed and out comes snow from heaven.
In the second edition of the book in 1819 they added some details, most prominently the rooster's greetings, provided by a correspondent: Georg August Friedrich Goldmann from [[Hanover]].<ref name=Bio.>{{cite web|title=Wilhelm Grimm|url=http://www.biography.com/people/wilhelm-grimm-21085173#grimms-fairy-tales|website=Bio.|accessdate=25 March 2015}}</ref> Like many other tales collected by the brothers Grimm the story of Frau Holle was told to teach a moral. In this case, it is that hard work is rewarded and laziness is punished.
==Synopsis== [[File:Frau Holle - Mauro Breda.jpg|420px|thumb|upright|Frau Holle]] A rich [[widow]] lives with her daughter and her stepdaughter. The widow favored her younger biological daughter allowing her to become spoiled and idle while her older stepdaughter was left to do all the work. Every day the stepdaughter would sit outside the cottage and [[Weaving (mythology)|spin]] beside the well.
One day she pricked her finger on the point of the [[Spindle (textiles)|spindle]]. Leaning over the well to wash the blood away, the spindle fell from her hand and sank out of sight. The stepdaughter feared that she would be punished for losing the spindle, and in a panic she leapt into the well after it.
The girl found herself in a meadow where she came upon an oven full of bread. The bread asked to be taken out before it burned. With a baker's [[Peel (tool)|peel]] she took all the loaves out and then walked on. Then she came to an apple tree that asked that its apples be harvested. So she did so and gathered them into a pile, before continuing on her way. Finally she came to a small house of an old woman, who offered to allow the girl to stay if she would help with the housework.
The woman identified herself as Frau Holle, and cautioned the girl to shake the featherbed pillows and coverlet well when she made the bed, as that would make it snow in the girl's world. The girl agreed to take service with Frau Holle, and took care to always shake the featherbed until the feathers flew about like snowflakes.
After a time, the girl became homesick and told Frau Holle that it was time for her to return home. Frau Holle had been impressed by the girl's kindness and hard work so much that when she escorted the girl to the gate, a shower of [[gold]] fell upon the girl. She also gave her the spindle which had fallen into the well. With that the gate was closed, and the girl found herself back, not far from her mother's house.
Her mother wished the same good fortune for her biological daughter. She also set her to sit by the well and spin, but the girl deliberately threw the spindle into the well before jumping in herself. She too came to the oven, but would not assist the bread; nor would she help the apple tree. When she came to Frau Holle's house, she likewise took service there, but before long fell into her lazy, careless ways. Frau Holle soon dismissed her. As the lazy girl stood at the gate, a kettle of [[Pitch (resin)|pitch]] spilled over her. "That is what you have earned," said Frau Holle, and closed the gate.
Other versions describe the first girl having a piece of gold fall from her lips every time she speaks whilst the second has a toad fall from her lips everytime she speaks.
<nowiki>*</nowiki> That is why, in [[Hessen]] whenever it snows they say that Frau Holle is making her bed.<ref>[http://www.pitt.edu/~dash/grimm024.html ''Frau Holle'', translated by D.L. Ashliman]</ref>
==Origins== [[Marija Gimbutas]] names Hulda (or [[Holda]], Holla, Holle) as having originally been an ancient Germanic supreme goddess who predates most of the Germanic pantheon, including deities such as [[Odin]], [[Thor]], [[Freya]], and [[Loki]], continuing traditions of [[Old European culture|pre-Indo-European]] [[Neolithic Europe]].<ref>Gimbutas, Marija, ''The Living Goddesses'' (Berkeley: University of California Press, 2001)</ref>
As Christianity slowly replaced Scandinavian paganism during the [[Early Middle Ages]], many of the old customs were gradually lost or assimilated into Christian tradition. By the end of the [[High Middle Ages]], Scandinavian paganism was almost completely marginalized and blended into rural [[folklore]], in which the character of Frau Hulda eventually survived.
In Germanic Pre-Christian folklore, Hulda, [[Holda]], Holle and Holla were all names to denote a single being. According to [[Erika Timm]], Perchta emerged from an amalgamation of Germanic and pre-Germanic, probably Celtic, traditions of the Alpine regions after the [[Migration Period]] in the Early Middle Ages.<ref>Timm, Erika. 2003. Frau Holle, Frau Percht und verwandte Gestalten: 160 Jahre nach Grimm aus germanistischer Sicht betrachtet.</ref> Hulda is also related to the Germanic figure of [[Perchta]]. She dwells at the bottom of a well, rides a wagon, and first taught the craft of making linen from flax. Holle is the goddess to whom children who died as infants go, and alternatively known as both the Dunkle Großmutter (Dark Grandmother) and the ''Weisse Frau'' (White Lady), elements which are more typically associated with the Grimms' fairy tale as well. Her connection to the spirit world through the magic of spinning and [[Weaving (mythology)|weaving]] has associated her with [[witchcraft]] in Catholic German folklore.
Frau Holle is one of Germany's most durable female legendary figures and represents a pre-Christian deity who survived in popular belief and in the memory of common people well into the nineteenth century.
==Perchta== {{Main|Perchta}}
The Grimms say Perchta or Berchta was known "precisely in those Upper German regions where Holda leaves off, in Swabia, in Alsace, in Switzerland, in Bavaria and Austria."<ref>Grimm, Jacob (1882). Deutsche Mythologie 4th ed. [1875]. Trans. James Stallybrass Grimm's Teutonic Mythology Volume 1.</ref> According to Jacob Grimm (1882), Perchta was spoken of in Old High German in the 10th century as Frau Berchta and thought to be a white-robed female spirit. She was known as a goddess who oversaw spinning and weaving, like myths of Holda in Continental German regions. He believes she was the feminine equivalent of Berchtold, and she was sometimes the leader of the [[Wild Hunt]].
According to Erika Timm, Perchta emerged from an amalgamation of Germanic and pre-Germanic, probably Celtic, traditions of the Alpine regions after the Migration Period in the Early Middle Ages.<ref>Timm, Erika. 2003. Frau Holle, Frau Percht und verwandte Gestalten: 160 Jahre nach Grimm aus germanistischer Sicht betrachtet.</ref>
==Analysis== Like many of the other tales collected by the Grimm brothers, "Frau Holle" personifies good behavior and bad, and the appropriate reward meted out for each. Even so, it also exhibits a number of contrasts with other stories. Typically, the magical beings who appear in the tales must enter the real world and appear to the protagonists before any intercession can take place. Moreover, these beings are almost always anonymous and therefore difficult to correlate with figures in pre-Christian mythology. By contrast, Frau Holle resides somewhere above the earth, and the protagonists must go to her, paradoxically by diving into a spring. When she makes her bed, loose feathers are 'stirred up' and fall to earth as snow, and so this fairy tale is an origin myth as well. Comparison between Frau Holle and a weather or earth goddess is inevitable. Jakob Grimm<ref>Jakob Ludwig Karl Grimm, transl J.S. Stallybrass.''[[Deutsche Mythologie|Teutonic Mythology]]''. George Bell, London 1882, pp 263f.</ref> notes that Thunar ([[Thor]]) makes rain in a similar fashion, implying for Frau Holle a very high rank in the pantheon.<ref>Grimm (1882) p268</ref>
Though not unique in this respect, the Frau Holle story is also notable for the absence of class-related motifs such as palaces, balls to which one may or may not be invited, and the rise to the status of the [[nobility]] through marriage.
According to the [[Aarne–Thompson classification systems|Aarne and Thompson classification system of fairy tales]], ''Mother Hulda'' is a story of type 480, ''The Kind and the Unkind Girls''. Others of this type include ''[[Shita-kiri Suzume]]'', ''[[Diamonds and Toads]]'', ''[[The Three Heads in the Well]]'', ''[[Father Frost (fairy tale)|Father Frost]]'', ''[[The Three Little Men in the Wood]]'', ''[[The Enchanted Wreath]]'', ''[[The Old Witch]]'', and ''[[The Two Caskets]]''.<ref>Heidi Anne Heiner, [http://www.surlalunefairytales.com/diamondstoads/other.html "Tales Similar to Diamonds and Toads"]</ref> Literary variants include ''[[The Three Fairies]]'' and ''[[Aurore and Aimée]]''.<ref>Jack Zipes, ''The Great Fairy Tale Tradition: From Straparola and Basile to the Brothers Grimm'', p 543, {{ISBN|0-393-97636-X}}</ref>
==See also== {{portal|Children's literature}} * [[Holda]], legendary protectress of agriculture and women's crafts. * ''[[Grandmother Winter]]'', a children's story based on Frau Holle * [[Kallo and the Goblins]] * [[Perchta]] * [[The Months]] * [[The Three Spinners]], a similar fairy tale, also collected by the Brothers Grimm. * [[Spillaholle]], a Silesian variant of Frau Holle particularly associated with spinning. * [[True and Untrue]]

[[File:Crystal Gradation.JPG|thumb|''Crystal Gradation'' by [[Paul Klee]], watercolour, 1921.]] '''Gradation''' in art is a visual technique of gradually transitioning from one colour hue to another, or from one shade to another, or one texture to another. Space, distance, atmosphere, volume, and curved or rounded forms are some of the visual effects created with gradation.<ref>{{cite book|last=Martin|first=Judy|title=The Encyclopedia of Pastel Techniques|year=1992|publisher=Running Press|location=Philadelphia, Pennsylvania|isbn=1-56138-087-3|pages=36}}</ref> [[File:Gradation.svg|thumb|A gradient illustration, showing a gradation spectrum from black to white.]] Artists use a variety of methods to create gradation, depending upon the art medium, and the precise desired effect. [[Blending (art)|Blending]], [[shading (art)|shading]], [[hatching]] and [[crosshatching]] are common methods. A fading effect can be created with [[pastels]] by using a [[torchon (art)|torchon]].<ref>{{cite book|last=Martin|first=Judy|title=The Encyclopedia of Pastel Techniques|year=1992|publisher=Running Press|location=Philadelphia, Pennsylvania|isbn=1-56138-087-3|pages=36}}</ref>
==Gradation in photography== Gradation can also be useful in composing photographs. The early decades of the development of photography involved much effort and experimentation aimed at improving gradation detail in photographs. Different materials were tested in producing lithographs and early photographs, with steady improvement in producing detailed gradation. In 1878, one photographer wrote: {{blockquote|The great defect of all the processes of photolithography described in the last section is that they can only be applied with advantage to the reproduction of drawings or subjects in which the gradation of shade is shown by lines or dots separated by white spaces of varying sizes and at varying intervals apart, as in line or stipple engravings and lithographs in line and chalk.<ref>{{cite journal|title=The British Journal of Photography|date=2007|orig-year=First published 1878|volume=XXV|pages=518|author=J. Waterhouse, Capt.|publisher=Oxford University}}</ref> }} [[File:Halftone example CMYK.png|thumb|Example of a halftone reproduction of a photograph.]] A major innovation was the development of [[halftone]] photography in the late 19th century. Halftone photography involves creating a reproduction of an original photograph by taking an image of it using a [[Photomechnical transfer camera (PMT)]], with a [[halftone screen]] as an intermediary tool to create gradation in the final reproduction. Halftone screens are a plate or film, made up of a continuous pattern of small dots, and when used in a photomechanical transfer camera, the halftone screen serves as an image filter. The invention of halftone photography was an important milestone, allowing photographs to be reproduced for mass publication in newspapers and magazines.
Analog photography is limited by the materials and equipment used by the photographer to capture gradation. These constraints are eliminated in digital photography, where software can be used to manipulate photograph images to create gradation.<ref>{{cite book|author1=Ralph Lambrecht |author2=Ralph W. Lambrecht |author3=Chris Woodhouse |title=Way Beyond Monochrome 2e: Advanced Techniques for Traditional Black & White ...|year=2010|publisher=Focal Press|isbn=978-0-240-81625-8|pages=124}}</ref>

{{For|Grassmann's law in linguistics|Grassmann's law}}
'''Grassmann's laws''' describe empirical results about how the perception of mixtures of colored lights (i.e., lights that co-stimulate the same area on the retina) composed of different [[spectral power distribution]]s can be algebraically related to one another in a color matching context. Discovered by [[Hermann Grassmann]]<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Grassmann|first1=H.|title=Zur Theorie der Farbenmischung|journal=Annalen der Physik und Chemie|date=1853|volume=165|issue=5|pages=69–84|doi=10.1002/andp.18531650505}}</ref> these "laws" are actually principles used to predict color match responses to a good approximation under [[photopic vision|photopic]] and [[mesopic vision|mesopic]] vision. A number of studies have examined how and why they provide poor predictions under specific conditions.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Pokorny|first1=Joel|last2=Smith|first2=Vivianne C.|last3=Xu|first3=Jun|title=Quantal and non-quantal color matches: failure of Grassmann’s laws at short wavelengths|journal=Journal of the Optical Society of America A|date=1 February 2012|volume=29|issue=2|pages=A324|doi=10.1364/JOSAA.29.00A324}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal|last1=Brill|first1=Michael H.|last2=Robertson|first2=Alan R.|title=Open Problems on the Validity of Grassmann's Laws|journal=Colorimetry|date=2007|pages=245–259|doi=10.1002/9780470175637.ch10/summary|url=http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/9780470175637.ch10/summary|publisher=John Wiley & Sons, Inc.|language=en}}</ref>
==Modern interpretation==
[[File:Grassman color circle 1853.png|right|thumb|Grassmann expressed his first law with respect to a circular arrangement of spectral colors in this 1853 illustration.<ref>{{cite book | title = Hermann Günther Grassmann (1809-1877): visionary mathematician, scientist and neohumanist scholar : papers from a sesquicentennial conference | authors = Hermann Grassmann, Gert Schubring | publisher = Springer | year = 1996 | isbn = 978-0-7923-4261-8 | page = 78 | url = https://books.google.com/books?id=PUifpzKWhLkC&printsec=frontcover&dq=grassman%27s+second+law+color+linear&as_brr=3&ei=HQg9SqDGLpDOlQT7mpW6BQ }}</ref>]]
The four laws are described in modern texts<ref>{{cite web|last1=Stevenson|first1=Scott|title=University of Houston Vision OPTO 5320 Vision Science 1 Lecture Notes|url=https://www.opt.uh.edu/onlinecoursematerials/stevenson-5320/vis_sci_02.pdf|website=University of Houston Vision OPTO 5320 Vision Science 1 Course Materials|accessdate=4 January 2018}}</ref> with varying degrees of algebraic notation and are summarized as follows (the precise numbering and corollary definitions can vary across sources<ref>{{cite book|last1=Judd|first1=Deane Brewster|last2=Technology|first2=Center for Building|title=Contributions to Color Science|date=1979|publisher=NBS|page=457|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=jgz_iI8NAzYC&pg=PA457&dq=%22Grassmann%27s+laws%22&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwi33N_uibXYAhVqr1QKHXwJCvYQ6AEIWDAI#v=onepage&q=%22Grassmann's%20laws%22&f=false|accessdate=6 January 2018|language=en}}</ref>): ---- {| |valign="top"|{{nowrap|'''First law''':}} |Two colored lights appear different if they differ in either dominant wavelength, luminance or ''purity''. Corollary: For every colored light there exists a light with a complementary color such that a mixture of both lights either desaturates the more intense component or gives uncolored (grey/white) light. |- |valign="top"|{{nowrap|'''Second law''':}} |The appearance of a mixture light made from two components changes if either component changes. Corollary: A mixture of two colored lights that are non-complementary result in a mixture that varies in hue with relative intensities of each light and in saturation according to the distance between the hues of each light. |- |valign="top"|{{nowrap|'''Third law''':}} |There are lights with different spectral power distributions but appear identical. First corollary: such identical appearing lights must have identical effects when added to a mixture of light. Second corollary: such identical appearing lights must have identical effects when subtracted (i.e., filtered) from a mixture of light. |- |valign="top"|{{nowrap|'''Fourth law''':}} |The intensity of a mixture of lights is the sum of the intensities of the components. This is also known as [[Abney's law]]. |} ----
These laws entail an algebraic representation of colored light.<ref>{{cite book|last1=Reinhard|first1=Erik|last2=Khan|first2=Erum Arif|last3=Akyuz|first3=Ahmet Oguz|last4=Johnson|first4=Garrett|title=Color Imaging: Fundamentals and Applications|date=2008|publisher=CRC Press|isbn=9781439865200|page=364|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=suLqBgAAQBAJ&pg=PA364&dq=grassman%27s+laws+additive&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjYz5iD8LPYAhWKxFQKHRrZCfgQ6AEINjAC#v=onepage&q=grassman's%20laws%20additive&f=false|language=en}}</ref> Assuming beam 1 and 2 each have a color, and the observer chooses <math>(R_1,G_1,B_1)</math> as the strengths of the primaries that match beam 1 and <math>(R_2,G_2,B_2)</math> as the strengths of the primaries that match beam 2, then if the two beams were combined, the matching values will be the sums of the components. Precisely, they will be <math>(R,G,B)</math>, where:
:<math>R= R_1+R_2\,</math> :<math>G= G_1+G_2\,</math> :<math>B= B_1+B_2\,</math>
Grassmann's laws can be expressed in general form by stating that for a given color with a [[Spectral density|spectral power distribution]] <math>I(\lambda)</math> the RGB coordinates are given by:
:<math>R= \int_0^\infty I(\lambda)\,\bar r(\lambda)\,d\lambda</math> :<math>G= \int_0^\infty I(\lambda)\,\bar g(\lambda)\,d\lambda</math> :<math>B= \int_0^\infty I(\lambda)\,\bar b(\lambda)\,d\lambda</math>
Observe that these are linear in <math>I</math>; the functions <math>\bar r(\lambda), \bar g(\lambda), \bar b(\lambda)</math> are the [[color matching function]]s with respect to the chosen primaries.
